subject: Programming
title: Log4Shell and Supply Chain Risk
description: A quick win: understand Log4Shell and Supply Chain Risk.

hook.text: In December 2021, a flaw in a tiny Java library put millions of servers at risk overnight.

buildup.text: Log4j was an open-source logging tool embedded in almost every Java application on Earth.

discovery.text: Attackers could send a crafted text string that made servers execute any remote code.

twist.text: One volunteer maintained the critical library part-time. Nobody had audited it.

climax.text: Log4Shell exposed how modern software depends on invisible, underfunded open-source components.

punchline.text: The internet ran on a library nobody was watching.
